page.title: 16WOODEATON SCHOOL
page.content: This is a school for slow-learning children of Oxfordshire. It is a weekly boarding school for 80 boys and girls between the ages of 7 - 16 years.There are 10 teaching staff including the Head and two classroom assistants. The Headmaster lives on the premises, but other staff travel in daily. There are seven houseparents who live in during the week. The part-time domestic staff come in from Islip and have to rely on their own transport. The building was used by the BBC during the 1939-45 war, but has been a school since about 1949. The annual fete in Woodeaton is held in the school grounds.
